availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Elza Thomason (Scott County, Kentucky, farmer and hotel keeper)

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, farmer and hotel keeper. Kentucky native. Father of John D. Thomason, Adelia Thomason, William Thomason, Elder J. Thomason, and Cora Thomason. Married to Eliza J. Thomason. Farmer in Scott County, Kentucky in 1850. Hotel keeper in Scott County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned 1 enslaved person in Scott County, Kentucky in 1860. Enrolled for military duty in Seventh District of Scott County, Kentucky on July 1, 1863 (U.S.A). Juror in E.H. Parrish ET Al to Thomas E. Bramlette in December 1864.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 2, p. 933.Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 1, p. 439.Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 1, p. 293. KYR-0001-004-1385.
